step.title: pfSense Setup Wizard
step.description: This wizard will guide you through installing pfSense initially.

step.title: General Information
step.description: On this screen you will set the General pfSense paramaters.

step.title: Time Server Information
step.description: Please enter the time, date and time zone.

field.name: Time server dns name
field.description: Enter the name of the time server.

step.title: Configure WAN Interface
step.description: On this screen we will configure the Wide Area Network information.

field.name: MAC Address
field.description: This field can be used to modify ("spoof") the MAC address of the WAN interface (may be required with some cable connections) Enter a MAC address in the following format: xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx or leave blank

field.name: MTU
field.description: If you enter a value in this field, then MSS clamping for TCP connections to the value entered above minus 40 (TCP/IP header size) will be in effect. If you leave this field blank, an MTU of 1492 bytes for PPPoE and 1500 bytes for all other connection types will be assumed.

field.name: Scheduler
field.description: Select which type of queueing you would like to use

field.name: DHCP Hostname
field.description: The value in this field is sent as the DHCP client identifier and hostname when requesting a DHCP lease. Some ISPs may require this (for client identification).

field.name: PPPoE Service name
field.description: Hint: this field can usually be left empty

field.name: PPPoE Dial on demand
field.description: This option causes the interface to operate in dial-on-demand mode, allowing you to have a virtual full time connection. The interface is configured, but the actual connection of the link is delayed until qualifying outgoing traffic is detected.

field.name: PPPoE Idle timeout
field.description: If no qualifying outgoing packets are transmitted for the specified number of seconds, the connection is brought down. An idle timeout of zero disables this feature.

field.name: PPTP Dial on demand
field.description: This option causes the interface to operate in dial-on-demand mode, allowing you to have a virtual full time connection. The interface is configured, but the actual connection of the link is delayed until qualifying outgoing traffic is detected.

field.name: PPTP Idle timeout
field.description: If no qualifying outgoing packets are transmitted for the specified number of seconds, the connection is brought down. An idle timeout of zero disables this feature.

field.name: BigPond Authentication server
field.description: If this field is left empty, the default ("dce-server") is used.

field.name: BigPond Authentication domain
field.description: If this field is left empty, the domain name assigned via DHCP will be used. Note: the BigPond client implicitly sets the "Allow DNS server list to be overridden by DHCP/PPP on WAN" on the System: General setup page.

field.name: BigPond min heartbeat interval
field.description: Setting this to a sensible value (e.g. 60 seconds) can protect against DoS attacks.

field.name: Block RFC1918 Private Networks
field.description: When set, this option blocks traffic from IP addresses that are reserved for private networks as per RFC 1918 (10/8, 172.16/12, 192.168/16) as well as loopback addresses (127/8). You should generally leave this option turned on, unless your WAN network lies in such a private address space, too.
field.typehint: Block private networks from entering via WAN

step.title: Configure LAN Interface
step.description: On this screen we will configure the Local Area Network information.

field.name: LAN IP Address
field.description: Type dhcp if this interface uses dhcp to obtain its ip address.

step.title: Set ADMIN Password
step.description: On this screen we will set the Admin password.

field.name: ADMIN Password AGAIN

step.title: Reboot
step.description: On this screen we will reboot pfSense so your changes will take affect..

step.title: Reboot in progress
step.description: A reboot is now in progress. Please wait.
